original: @150b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @150b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: s'i ta t'a r'a s'a dha nam /
analyzed: s'i ta t'a r'a s'a dha nam /
translated: Sitatārāsādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: sgrol ma dkar mo'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: sgrol ma dkar mo'i sgrub thabs /
translated: Sitatārāsādhana

original: 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Noble Tārā.

original: sngon ma bzhin du stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon ma bzhin du stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: As before, [there is] emptiness and so forth.

original: de nas sum yig yongs su gyur pa las rin po che sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi ri rab bo //
analyzed: de nas sum yig yongs su gyur pa las rin po che sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi ri rab bo //
translated: Then, from the transformation of the syllable suṃ, [there is] Mount Meru, which is the nature of various jewels.

original: de'i steng du pam yig las padma dkar po'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du pam yig las padma dkar po'o //
translated: Upon that, from the syllable paṃ, [there is] a white lotus.

original: de'i steng du aa yig las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i steng du aa yig las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Upon that, from the syllable a, [there is] a moon maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du h'um yig dkar po yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma dkar mo spyan gsum pa /
analyzed: de'i steng du h'um yig dkar po yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma dkar mo spyan gsum pa /
translated: Upon that, from the complete transformation of a white syllable hūṃ, [there is] the Blessed Lady White Tārā, with three eyes,

original: phyag bzhi pa //
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa //
translated: with four arms,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dbu rgyan can /
translated: with a crown ornament of the five tathāgatas,

original: sna tshogs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with various ornaments,

original: phyag gnyis kyis autpa la'i phyag rgya mdzad pa /
analyzed: phyag gnyis kyis autpa la'i phyag rgya mdzad pa /
translated: with the gesture of an utpala in two hands,

original: phyag g-yas na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang yang dag par ldan pa'i mchog sbyin gyis sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang yang dag par ldan pa'i mchog sbyin gyis sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa /
translated: In his right hand he holds a wish-fulfilling gem and makes the boon-granting gesture, fulfilling the wishes of all sentient beings.

original: g-yon na autpa la'i snye ma bsnams pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon na autpa la'i snye ma bsnams pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: In his left hand he holds a cluster of utpala flowers.

original: de'i g-yas phyogs su 'od zer can sku mdog ser mo zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa na bza' sngon po can /
analyzed: de'i g-yas phyogs su 'od zer can sku mdog ser mo zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa na bza' sngon po can /
translated: To his right is yellow Marīci, standing on a moon disc, wearing blue garments,

original: phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa /
translated: with two arms,

original: phyag g-yon na mya ngan med pa'i shing dmar po'i yal ga bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon na mya ngan med pa'i shing dmar po'i yal ga bsnams pa /
translated: holding in her left hand a branch of a red aśoka tree,

original: g-yas na rnga yab dkar po bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yas na rnga yab dkar po bsnams pa /
translated: and in her right hand a white yak-tail whisk.

original: stod gos dmar pos brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: stod gos dmar pos brgyan pa'o //
translated: She is adorned with a red upper garment.

original: g-yon phyogs logs su rma bya chen mo pri yam ku'i me tog lta bu ljang gu phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: g-yon phyogs logs su rma bya chen mo pri yam ku'i me tog lta bu ljang gu phyag gnyis pa /
translated: To his left is Mahāmāyūrī, green like a priyaṅgu flower, with two arms,🔽holding in her left hand a peacock’s tail feather,

original: g-yon na rma bya'i mjug sgro bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yon na rma bya'i mjug sgro bsnams pa /
translated: and in her right hand a yak-tail whisk.

original: g-yas na rnga yab bsnams pa de lta bu'i rnam pa gsal pa la /
analyzed: g-yas na rnga yab bsnams pa de lta bu'i rnam pa gsal pa la /
translated: Visualize her in that form.

original: aom bha ga ba ti t'a re ma ma hri da yam pra bi sha sv'a h'a /🔽zhes pas bdag nyid byin gyis brlab par bya'o //🔽de @151a * //
analyzed: aom bha ga ba ti t'a re ma ma hri da yam pra bi sha sv'a h'a / zhes pas bdag nyid byin gyis brlab par bya'o // de @151a * //
translated: Oṃ, Blessed One, Tārā, enter into my heart, svāhā.

original: nas sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: nas sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then one should recite the mantra.

original: aom na mo t'a re ma no ha ra h'um ha ra sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom na mo t'a re ma no ha ra h'um ha ra sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ namo tāre māṃ harahūṃ hara svāhā.

original: sgrol ma dkar mo'i sgrub thabs slob dpon yid bzhin nor bu'i rgyal pos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sgrol ma dkar mo'i sgrub thabs slob dpon yid bzhin nor bu'i rgyal pos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of White Tārā composed by Master Cintamani Rāja is complete.
